feed.title: Bare Metal Cloud Status - Incident History

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - API change for OS reinstallation
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 10, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

May 22, 22:51 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our API offer.

This will affect some functionality.

Start time : 10/09/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 10/09/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy, API will stop to accept SSH key id for OS reinstallation.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - API call removal
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 3, 08:30 - 08:45 UTC

May 28, 22:23 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our API.

The 03th of July 2024, the following API call will be definitely removed:
GET /dedicated/server/{serviceName}/install/templateCapabilities

Start time : 03/07/2024 08:30 UTC
End time : 03/07/2024 08:45 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : This API call was previously useful for old Windows OS installers that were not compatible with installation on another diskgroup on servers with multiple diskgroups.
Since then all OSes can be installed on any diskgroup.

Thank you for your understanding.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - iPXE script boot migration
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jun 25, 13:00 - 13:15 UTC

May 22, 22:14 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our iPXE API offer.

If you have never used the OVHcloud API, then you can ignore this message since this feature is not and has never been available in the OVHcloud control panel.

In the past months, we have simplified the API call format used to boot a server from a custom iPXE script: see documentation.

Start time : 25/06/2024 13:00 UTC
End time : 25/06/2024 13:15 UTC
Service impact : None
Service improvement : If your server is still configured to boot from iPXE scripts in the old location, starting from 25th of June 2024 we will change it to the new location under the bootScript attribute for the affected dedicated servers.
You don't need to reboot your server. Next time the server will reboot it will be completely smooth and automatically boot from iPXE script in new location.

entry.title: [Global][Operating System] - Removal of the vSphere Hypervisor (ESXi 7.x and 8.x)
entry.content:
Jun 6, 10:07 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jun 6, 09:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jun 4, 15:03 UTC
Scheduled - Due to Broadcom's acquisition of VMware, Broadcom has decided to end the general availability of their Free vSphere Hypervisor (ESXi). OVHcloud will remove all ESXi images from our Operating System Template Catalog for our BareMetal Dedicated Servers on June, 6th 2024.

Start time : 06/06/2024 09:00 UTC
End time : 06/06/2024 09:30 UTC
Service impact : Free vSphere Hypervisor (ESXi) images removed

Please note that this change will not impact your current servers utilizing ESXi images.
However, you will not be able to reinstall your current server or install a new server using any of the ESXi templates previously provided by OVHcloud.

entry.title: [RBX1/RBX2][Dedicated Servers] - Servers migration from RBX1 to RBX2
entry.content:
Jun 5, 01:14 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jun 2, 22:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

May 17, 03:56 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 02/06/2024 22:00 UTC
End time : 05/06/2024 05:00 UTC
Service impact : Servers being moved from RBX1 to RBX2 might be unavailable for up to 7 hours during the night (22:00 UTC => 05:00 UTC).
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will have to move servers from RBX1 to RBX2 due to the EoL (End of life) of RBX1.

entry.title: [GRA2][Dedicated Servers] - Racks G209B18 - G209B17 - G209B16
entry.content:
Jun 4, 13:29 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 04/06/2024 08:48 UTC
End time : 04/06/2024 13:10 UTC
Service impact :The situation is back to normal, the service is running nominally.
Root cause : It was due to a malfunction on some hardwares..

Jun 4, 11:54 UTC
Update - Servers in rack G209B18 are reachable.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

Jun 4, 10:08 UTC
Update - Servers in rack G209B16 are reachable.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

Jun 4, 09:30 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jun 4, 09:21 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 04/06/2024 08:48 UTC
Service impact : Some of servers in racks G209B18 - G209B17 - G209B16 are no longer responding.
Ongoing actions : Our teams are investigating to determine the origin of the incident and fix it.
Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [Global][Dedicated Servers] - OS Installation
entry.content:
Jun 4, 13:15 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 13/05/2024 09:00 UTC
End time : 03/06/2024 15:00 UTC
Service impact : The situation is back to normal, the service is running nominally.
Root cause :A malfunction on a software has been corrected.

May 31, 07:50 UTC
Identified - Start time : 13/05/2024 09:00 UTC
Service impact : Some customers are unable to install the chosen OS
Root cause : https://bare-metal-servers.status-ovhcloud.com/incidents/hc28b8ppr7q8
Ongoing actions : Our teams have found the cause and are working on resolving the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

entry.title: [RBX8][Dedicated Servers] - R809L03
entry.content:
Jun 3, 04:32 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 03/06/2024 02:30 UTC
End time : 03/06/2024 04:29 UTC
Root cause : Incident due to water cooling issue.
Our technical teams resolved the issue. All impacted services are now operational.

Jun 3, 03:28 UTC
Update - The majority of the servers are now operational and our technical teams are still at work on the rest.

Jun 3, 02:48 UTC
Identified - Start time : 03/06/2024 02:30 UTC
Service impact : Some servers in rack R809L03 are no longer responding.
Root cause : Incident due to water cooling issue.
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on a fix.
